review_text: We came with 6 girls for a bachelorette weekend and I can't say enough good things about our experience. Candice was great to work with and so patient with my questions and booking process. She even helped us find an uber to take us around. The outdoor seating area was a great spot to hang out and enjoy the evening! She takes care of her property and we felt right at home. You can easily tell that Candice put this home together with her guests in mind. The house was so clean with great decor and the beds were comfortable. The outside area is perfect with the hanging lights and fire pit. Plenty of seating inside and outside. She gave me recommendations for wineries and places to go in the evenings. The check in and out process was easy and well explained. I highly recommend this property!

review_text:
I rate Candice’s Airbnb 5/5. Our family stay for one night at Candice’s Airbnb went better than expected. First of all, this Airbnb was the only location that could accommodate more than 4 people in a 30 minute radius of Geneva College, we traveled with 8 people, including a baby. Candice had baby toys ( bouncer & play pen) which was really nice.
Candice accommodated an early check-in, had items labeled for easy access and decorations in the home were beautiful. Candice maintained communication with me which was very helpful. There were also a variety of toiletries in the bathroom, snacks in the fridge/kitchen and a many pillows & blankets ,which were comfortable :). I definitely recommend this location for others and would return if ever back in the area.

Group trip
review_text: Candice is a fabulous host! Couldn’t have been more responsive and willing to help in any way possible. The place is gorgeous and exactly as described. We were in the second floor apartment and the setup was ideal for everything being on the same floor. It’s a long apartment with a large living space in the front and the bedrooms all the way on the opposite end with the bathroom and kitchen in between, so none of the noise from the living space bled into the bedrooms. There are also room darkening curtains, in case you need to sleep during the day at all. Great stay all around! Would definitely stay again the next time we’re in the area!

name: Kelly
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

May 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We needed a place to stay for a family wedding and Candice’s place was perfect! From the location close to the venue to all of the amenities she provided it was a perfect match. The apartment was spotless, the towels and linens were luxurious. She had little surprises like snacks and drinks, as well as travel size toiletries in the bathroom in case you forget something. Of course, we had forgotten our toothbrushes! Couch was comfy and the BIG television with ROKU was perfect for movie watching. The master king size bed was so comfortable after two long nights and there is no lack of pillows! While there were only two of us traveling, we did not take advantage of the full size dining table or the second bedroom with two sets of bunks, making this perfect for families. I saw many board games and toys as well! She has thought of everything a guest could want or need! Met her in person and she was just charming! Would stay here again for sure! HIGHLY recommend!

review_text: The place was perfect for our quick stay! Its not much on the outside but it's great on the inside- well furnished and decorated, the host didn't skimp, it felt like a home. It was very clean, even spotless. There were a variety of comfortable beds to choose from- which is a plus for picky sleepers like me. The host went out of the way to accommodate my kids- toys, high chair, bumper, etc. My kids felt comfortable there and got right to playing. The TV is ginormous. The couch was really big and comfortable. The shower/bathroom was spotless with travel sizes toiletries in case you forget something. Great place to crash if you're visiting the area or driving through. It has a few of those plug-in air fresheners if you like that kind of thing (I'm not a fan but I just unplug them and put them back when we leave). I would def stay here again next time.

Stayed one night
review_text: The first word that comes to mind about this airbnb is orderly. Even the shampoo/conditioner/wash were lined up perfectly on the shelf in the shower. Very clean. I've stayed in a few musty spaces, lipstick on a pig places on this trip with photos straight out of the real estate playbook, but Ken & Arianna's place is not one of them. I think it looked better in person than the photos. Also, despite being connected to the house, it was rather peaceful and if you open the window, you can hear plenty of clip clop from the Amish buggies during daylight hours. Only occasional garage door opening noise. I prefer a checkout at 11am instead of 10am, but I didn't request it and the hosts say you can do so with lead time. Would stay again.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: My husband and I traveled from Virginia and stayed two nights at Arianna's and Ken's Private Above Garage Studio Apartment in New Wilmington, PA in August 2021. It was such a great location for us to be able to attend a family reunion and visit with a family member in the Shenango Presbyterian Senior Care Center! The apartment was very clean and pleasant and located in a quiet neighborhood close to down town New Wilmington. We love the country fresh air and although there was air conditioning, we so enjoyed relaxing on the sofa in front of the open windows and hearing an occasional clip clop of horse hoofs from the Amish horse and buggies and also the chimes of the church bells. It was like stepping back in time! The private back entrance with locking keypad made for easy and secure access. Arianna and Ken were great communicators and hosts. We would definitely stay here again if we are back in the area.

review_text: Croton still looks a bit rundown which is sad. This house and the neighboring houses are all well maintained. Candice confirmed that the Ladies of the Dukes is still up and running on Sundays and it’s only a few blocks away. Unfortunately we had to leave on Saturday. I haven’t been there for 20+ years and I plan on making the trip on a Sunday morning for nostalgic reasons but also because the meatballs and sauce are amazing. Candice keeps this place spotless. I mean really spotless. She also thinks of every little thing you might need like every type of toiletry, feminine products, etc. You know you are dealing with a good host when you see this. Overall it is a great place to stay if you need to be in the New Castle area. We hiked McConell’s Mill State Park which was maybe 15 minutes drive.

Stayed with kids
review_text: The most perfect place we have stayed at. Candice has truly thought of everything. She left us travel size toiletries in the bathroom for the things we forgot to pack. There were even feminine products available. The light switches were labelled so you did not have to figure out which one was where. The outside games were so fun, my kids had a blast! She had extension cords set up to make it convenient to charge your phone. Little ledges for your phone set up by all of the beds. She even had phone chargers both android and iphone plugged in and ready to go upon arrival. We were greeted with snacks and a very well put together book of local suggestions for things to do, sights to see, and places to eat. The home was decorated with care, I did not feel like it was random furniture put into the home to make it look full as they do at many airbnbs. We absolutely loved this stay. There is not a single thing I could say against it. Wish we could have stayed longer! Thank you!!

We saw a deer on a hiking trail less than a mile away and that was really serene, and the hosts also provided really good recommendations to local stores/restaurants. The neighborhood was really peaceful and quiet and the lounge view was absolutely breathtaking. We'd love to stay there again! Lots of nature which is always wonderful. Thank you again for letting us stay!

Stayed about a week
review_text:
A great place to stay for the week. Robert is an experienced host and the place has everything needed and then some. It's like visiting a family members home.
Great walking options around town. Look for Jeff and Melinda's love lock on the bridge fence behind Shop and Save. Don't forget your own lock to pace on the bridge.
The most unique feature of the house is the lodge, complete with Dennis the stuffed deer head (who has a great smile and looks like the coach from Rudolph the Red nosed Reindeer) and Pete, the styrofoam polar bear head (don't ask. Mel had to name them). The lodge has a treehouse view over the gorge behind the house and gives the place a surreal feeling.
Not much else to say. The host was very accommodating, beds comfy, bathroom good. I don't think it would be good for wheelchair bound, but otherwise a great place, well worth the stay.

review_text:
This home is a wonderful, quiet place to stay when in the area. It is so comfortable and well equipped. I loved the patio and the ability to enjoy the outside while I was there. We had everything we needed to enjoy a quiet, relaxing time.
A couple notes for future guests:
Please note there is a step down then up to get into the dining room, and then 2 steps down to the lodge. This wasn't an issue for us, but if someone has difficulty with mobility, those steps could be an issue.
The home is located in a very quiet neighborhood, and the home is very close to both neighbors on each side. One neighbor from across the street was extremely friendly to us and came over to talk. But many of the neighbors just stared at us, even if we waved. So please be aware that there may be some people who may not be too happy that this home is an airbnb. We were very quiet and respectful while staying there, but if you want to be loud, this is not the place for you!

My husband and I stayed at Robert's house while in town for a family member's special event. It is a quiet, peaceful setting with a beautiful nature view at the back of the house. The house is in a neighborhood, but from the large windows at the back of the house it feels like a house in the woods.
There was literally nothing we needed. Robert's instructions for checking in were easy to follow. Everything was easy to find. There were some books to read, a nice chess set, relaxing home-away-from-home feel. Morning coffee in "the lodge" while watching birds was my favorite.

review_text: This is a great little house in a quiet neighborhood. Everything looks new and fresh including the kitchen appliances. The view from the covered back patio is lovely too. We had great communication, and even though he was traveling out of the country during my trip he made sure to make me welcome and ensure that my needs were met. I chose this home for its location which is only about 30 minutes from Moraine State Park and McConnell's Mill - a photographer's dream (wild flowers were out in force this week!) and also great for hiking, boating, fishing, and bicycling. It is also well-situated for a day trip to Erie if one wished, or to Grove City Outlets, and an excursion into the city of Pittsburgh. I hope to stay again some time in the future.

review_text: I loved this place. My daughter and I went to visit Grove City College. This spot is a nice 20 minute drive from there. The place is REALLY nice, clean, and unique. I didn't get it when we booked but the place actually was a carriage house at one point. It sits right behind the main house. The garage doors (there are three) are all about the size of a carriage (not a car). Parking was easy. The owners were very responsive to requests. The place is basically a one room apartment (above the carriage area. When you enter, you do have to climb a very steep stairwell. Both the bed and the roll out were comfortable. The living room area is nice - the couch and chairs look good and are super easy to lounge in. There is a pizza place across the street that is decent. A coffee shop, bar, and Rite Aid are literally steps away. Very nice and very comfortable place. We will be back!!!!!

Upon learning the date for our granddaughter's graduation from Westminster College, we quickly rented the Carriage House apartment (along with 3 rooms at the Inn - about a 40 foot walk from the Carriage House via the shared courtyard lawn) to attend her graduation ceremony this May.
The Carriage House (and Inn) is centrally located and an easy walk to the campus and the local microbrewery/hard seltzer/micro winery. New Wilmington is a tiny, pretty town - restaurants are few and casual .
We loved the Carriage House accommodations - furnishings were comfy and bathrooms were nicely updated. Everything was spotless.
Angel and Brian were tremendous hosts - so friendly, welcoming, and engaging.
We highly recommend the Carriage House, we could not have asked for better accommodations and hosts.

When she visited the apartment, we spent time in the family room, kitchen, and even ate dinner around the kitchen table, everything was very cozy, like home - but away from home. We live 5+ hours away so this was perfect. The apartment is very clean and impeccably furnished, the kitchen is well-equipped with everything you need. We have stayed with Brian and Angel in the past, they are the most amazing hosts. They also respond promptly when you have any questions and check-in to make sure you have what you need. We look forward to our next visit, we will definitely stay in this apartment again!

Stony Brook Cottage exceeds expectations in every way!! It is a beautiful setting on a wooded bluff above a scenic river. Easy to find with gps and plenty of parking. The cottage is beautifully renovated with immaculate and comfortable decor and furnishings. The kitchen is well equipped with all you need to prepare meals, have fresh morning coffee and Jason even provides snacks! Nice toiletries in the bathroom too! Everything about this cottage is very comfortable and high quality!
Communication with Jason was so easy and friendly.
We will definitely be looking for an opportunity to come back!
Thank you, Jason!

name: Amanda
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Jason was an awesome host!! The cabin is amazing and the attention to detail is seen and felt throughout. We have stayed in our fair share of rentals and this was by far the cleanest (I’d go so far as to say immaculate) place we have ever rented. The craftsmanship of the home can be seen with every detail and the perfection with which the home was built is the same perfection with which Jason welcomes his guests. So many details are overlooked with rentals these days but not at the cabin. From a well thought out welcome packet outlining any question a renter may have, to the small, tactful labeling of light fixtures allowing one to know which fixture operates which set of lights, there seems to be nothing Jason hasn’t thought of. I cannot say enough about the cleanliness and obvious attention to detail that is put into this space. It is serene and peaceful, yet close enough to great outdoor activities and all Pittsburgh has to offer. Hope to be in the area to stay again. 10 out of 10!

review_text: We stayed at Jason’s cottage for the first 4 nights of our trip to see family, then had plans to stay at another airbnb closer to my family’s house for the last 3 nights of the trip. We left Jason’s Monday morning and got to the other Airbnb, whose listing was misleading and found that it was not clean and smelled very bad of horse manure. I didn’t feel comfortable staying there, so we checked to see if Jason’s place was still available, and it was! We booked it out of there so fast and came right back to Jason’s place where we felt at home! We were so relieved to be back, and Jason was so welcoming and kind. You will not find a cleaner place than this, and the beautiful serene atmosphere is icing on the cake. Loved how close to hiking and state parks this is as well. We will definitely be staying here the next time we come out to visit family!

An easy drive to campus but also close to Pittsburgh, we were very comfortable and had a great time around the fire pit, down at the river, and playing games in the spacious living area. The rooms are beautifully decorated and well-stocked yet we were not nervous about having three small children with us…it just felt homey and welcoming. As you can read in other reviews, there is a lot of noise from the road as well as between floors, but this really didn’t bother us. It was more than worth it to be together in such a beautiful, cozy, fun place. Anita was responsive and helpful! Note: drive the 9 minutes south to May’s Donuts, you won’t be sorry!!

Anita and her family thought of the smallest details that made a big difference, e.g. cotton rounds, tissues, and Q tips in the bathrooms, a completely stocked kitchen, snacks out to welcome us, and wood for the fireplace ready to go. It felt like we were real guests at their home. While the cabin itself is a treasure, the property makes you feel like you're in a movie scene - a beautiful lighted deck leads to your own woods and Slippery Rock Creek view. Very peaceful and beautiful. This cabin is minutes from McConnells Mill State Park - which is a must see if you're staying here. Thank you, Anita and Bill! We hope to be back!

Stayed with kids
review_text: Rainbow bend was a perfect family weekend for us. Plenty of space in the cabin for the kids to play and handy to have the smart TV with streaming services available for downtime for them. Decor is a rustic cabin vibe with lots of vintage items and hunting memorabilia displayed (which is perfect for my kids). Water was too high due to recent rains for good fishing with the kids along the nearby river off the dock (inevitable this time of year) but the nearby fly shop pointed us to a more fishable area with preschoolers. (The river would have been ok for fishing without small children at this flow). But the best part was the feeder creek through the property with lots of salamanders. Finding salamanders and crayfish is one of our kids' top activities and this was a wonderland for them. The hillsides are very steep, but doable if you're willing to get a little dirty. Overall, cabin was clean and comfortable but the creek made our trip!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Very cool place inside. Great private location. Lots of wildlife roaming around. Host was responsive and friendly. The creek isn’t super accessible if you have bad knees or any mobility issues. It’s a very steep, slippery climb down some old crumbling railroad tie steps. Make sure you test each step before putting your weight on it. Same with the deck steps. Pictures make it look like it’s right on the water. It’s not. We planned to grill dinner based on the listing of a grill available and the picture of the grill on the deck. Unfortunately it was nasty, unusable, and rusted with a big rodent nest inside it. The kitchen had everything we needed to adjust though, including a nice set of seasoned cast iron skillets. The steaks still turned out good. It wasn’t the “grill on a creek side deck with a water view” that we expected based on the pictures and description but still a very interesting, private place to stay.

Stayed with kids
review_text:
we stayed here last year and had a wonderful family bonding vacation. last year, we played a board game there and planned to play it this year. When we got home late the first full night, we wanted to play the game. we couldn't find it. I reached out to Matthew seeing if he knew where it may be, thinking he'd reply the next day, but instead replied right back. Come to find out his son took the game. Matthew suggested playing a different game that night and offered to bring the other game over at lunchtime the next day. I was NOT expecting him to do that for a board game. but he did.
Our family is already excited to return next year.
If you do stay, make sure you make a fire it warms the home up so much and is so beautiful.
The Xbox was also a hit for the boys.
the only thing that we saw different, and for the better is the door lock is keyless, we didn't know how to lock the door at first. to lock it press the Brink button. Notes are still for a KEY lock. :)

The bed in the master was extremely “squeaky” and very soft. The towels were old and very scratchy. Personal stuff in every drawer and closet we noticed when looking for more towels. (Soup)? Was dried on the microwave turntable. The scratchers and dish wands in the sink were old, dirty and sour smelling. Spider webs around the door entrance. Not very inviting.
Over all we were able to rest and relax (what we came to do). Our First impression, too much clutter for an air B&B.

review_text: Matthew’s house is amazing. It’s truly in the top 5 air bnbs we’ve stayed in. It was clean and cozy and had a nice kitchen with all of the amenities. But more than that, it’s such a beautiful and interesting space. It’s like staying in a cozy, homey museum because there are so many curiosities and interesting artifacts. The property is absolutely breathtaking. The creek is right there. You can easily sit on the deck and listen to it and watch the sun glint off the water. You can also walk down the hill to a dock and sit right next to it. The walk down to the dock is steep and might not be great in wet or icy weather but it was fine for us. Overall, we had a great time!

What a wonderful stay we had at the cabin. It had rained, snowed, and was a little wet outside during our stay but the cabin was warm and comfortable inside. It felt inviting and cozy. The highlight was finding an old chess board in the closet and the entire family playing each other over our entire stay while having the fireplace roaring in the back.
The boys were excited to find a game system hooked up to the living room TV.
On this vacation, this was stop 4 for us and the master bed was such a refreshing comfort on my body; super soft.
If you are staying on a Saturday check out one of my favorite spots at, "donuts on Saturday" that the Amish make. I was so excited to find out the cabin was less than 15 mins away from their home.
We were concerned about how tight the driveway was going to be to turn around, but there is plenty of room to turn your car around safely.
I reached out to Matthew a couple of times and he was very responsive.
Water was Beautiful. Will Return For Sure.

The BnB was well reflected in the pictures and description that was provided.

name: Lorain
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
May 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Most unique home we've stayed in. Fascinating books from guitars, birds, rugs, fishing, photography... you're bound to find something fascinating in the hundreds of books. There's a smaller creek to one side which feeds into a bigger river. The house is such a solid log cabin build it is wonderfully quiet, but you can open a window or door to hear the rushing water. It is an official Audubon wildlife, bird and butterfly sanctuary. The leather couches are super soft and the kitchen is fully stocked (spice rack, pantry items). The main bed is a bit creaky getting in, but comfortable throughout the night. Water is hot and strong.
If you're looking for a pristine hotel room this is not it. Every nook and cranny has an interesting object (arrowheads, fishing flies, brass antiques, artwork, stained glass, rugs, antler chandelier) to explore. It's more like you're visiting a multi-faceted, learned uncle and he's been collecting his whole life.
The house is older, but you can tell the quality materials throughout. In the shady and wet environment, the deck could use a good power wash and some new furnishings. All these objects probably require constant dusting, so not for allergy sufferers.
A short drive to historic Volant or Newcastle, but feels like a million miles away.

An absolute Gem! The perfect place to take a breathe and recharge. The cabin is a work of art. So much to look at and read. The books were an endless supply of interest. The decks were their own ecosystem.🤗 we cooked in the kitchen which was well supplied to produce great meals. The path to the creek was a reversion to childhood. We learned quickly to bring a flashlight for the trip back up! We would love to experience the cabin in another season, because even in February it was a Haven. Thank-you for sharing your cabin that exudes love, comfort, and acceptance. We would like to know the story behind “ no mantle hanging”. Did not know that was a thing, but we could tell it didn’t end well for someone.🤕🥰
Thank-you for a fabulous weekend!

review_text:
The house has so much history and it’s like walking in a museum. Pretty great. I was pretty excited to be here as well, But practically, It’s an average experience.. It’s true you can connect with nature coz it’s surrounded by a lot of trees etc. however if you are expecting a water overlook that’s not how it is although the description says so. There is a little deck when you walk down about 50 stairs but then again you still have to have a ladder (provided) to climb down. Water isn’t clean enough to dive in.
And the house deck needs a lot of upkeep work that’s due. And house is a legacy (I get that) but it’s not the most comfortable when it comes to bathrooms and bedroom arrangements. Again this is my view coz I enjoy comfort. But I guess if you are looking for some hikes or fishing, you might enjoy this outdoor activities. It’s definitely that but not so much a house view a nice relaxing view. .

Stayed one night
review_text: Great price, safe residential neighborhood and off street parking. Accurate to the listing. Good for overnight or two. Appeared to be clean, no smells! The futon couch which is intended for another bed is very uncomfortable for sleeping. For a couch it was ok. Would have been nice to have either room darkening blinds or curtains. Kitchenette is adequate! Wouldn't want to fix a Thanksgiving dinner in it! Shower is very small, but great water flow and good and hot. Ton's of towels. The Amazon LG flat screen is a pain to use. Very slow internet also. Could use better ceiling lighting and a ceiling fan would help circulate the old electric baseboard heating (3). It was very cold when we arrived, but in an hour it warmed up. Ample sheets and blankets could use some more bed pillows for the bed and futon. All in all for our purposes it was fine. Nice host.

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2023
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: The stay at Christina's AirBnB was a very lovely experience. There were minimal downsides and a few nice surprises. One surprise was that we thought there was only a fridge, but the fridge has an included freezer box on the inside. The AirBnB was very cute and cozy. It had way more storage in the closets than expected. There were multiple ways to control the temperature inside the AirBnB (there was a learning curve, but then it was simple). We had some family issues come up and she was very flexible about our arrival/checkout. Things to be aware of are: the shower is extremely tiny, the futon isn't the most comfortable but it works, and the walls are very thin. You will hear traffic, voices, etc. But we felt these downsides were not enough to lower the rating beneath 5 stars. Christina was, herself, very responsive and made it an easy stay. Overall, her description of "charming" sums up her listing quite well. We would love to stay again some day in the future.

Small but perfect.
we spent the weekend racing at Pittsburgh Raceway and this was the perfect spot to hang out, rest and sleep. It is a small efficiency but it has everything you need to be comfortable while checking out the local shops, restaurants or like us go to the races.
Note: the bed is super comfortable.
The area is quiet and you are right near downtown Ellwood which is a nice stroll to check shops out, coffee, bakery or a meadery.
It is small but given the area, the cost, the amenities (internet works great) I would say it was worth it and we will probably try to reserve it for future races in the area.

This studio truly is charming. As is the neighborhood and Ellwood City. My partner and I had been doing long distance from Chicago to Philadelphia and decided to meet in the middle. We couldn’t have asked for a cozier, more perfect home for our mini vacation.
The studio is separate from the house and with the back entrance we felt like we had total privacy. It was well stocked with everything we needed. We even did a little cooking! There is a lovely park only a few blocks away with walking trails along the river and some great restaurants in town.
We are hoping our long-distance stint will be coming to an end soon, but if not, we will definitely be back!

review_text: This was a good choice for an overnight for my daughter's college visit at Grove City. The location was about 35 min from the college in a nice private neighborhood. The venue was lovely, clean, and neat. Nice touches like flannel sheets and good coffee, bottled water and soft towels. Plenty of baseboard heat and a small space heater. Christina met us when we arrived and made us feel welcome while she remained unobtrusive. Thank you.

This is such a beautiful, comfortable, and peaceful place to stay! Same as everyone else, we loved the large deck with all its seating and its beautiful view. It was very fun to see the occasional Amish horse and buggy drive past.
The kitchen was well stocked and we appreciated the Keurig coffee machine.
The beds and couch were comfortable and there were lots of extra blankets available.
We also enjoyed using the fire pit on a particularly lovely evening.
Overall, we had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend this place!

Group trip
review_text: Two-weeks after our visit, and we’re still talking about our lovely stay at the Amish Paradise. Arrived at night, the porch was lit-up and gorgeous. Very comfortable, clean, easy open-floor plan layout inside. Loved the big L-couch, great for hanging out. We cooked a lot all weekend, the kitchen was perfect. A couple other visiting family members joined us for meals, lots of room for that. The eating area opens to the porch, so inside/outside gathering was easy. We couldn’t get enough of porch view, rain or shine (with a rainbow over the valley during the day and northern lights at night!). New fire pit which we’ll try out next time. Gina was our host contact, so kind and helpful and very prompt. This is a wonderful find for multiple guests. I highly recommend it, we hope to be back!

review_text: The house was just like the pictures but better, and the property is gorgeous. Home rentals are often missing something important, like a lamp by the bedside or extra towels. This place truly had everything we needed. The giant wrap around deck was my favorite part; I only wish I had more time to enjoy it. Gina reached out every step of the way to make sure we had everything we needed, and we actually met Ed when we returned to the property to retrieve a few things my granddaughter had forgotten. He was so kind and accommodating! I highly recommend this home!

review_text:
We came to Western PA for the funeral of a beloved family member. We needed a place to be when we weren’t at celebration of life activities. This house was absolutely perfect. Because the death was sudden and we were in a hurry to travel, obviously, we forgot to pack a few things. The house had literally everything I needed. The pictures online looked amazing. But the house in person looks even more remarkable. There is an extreme attention to detail and comfort in the home. Gina even had it decorated for Christmas, which was very nice since we had to be away from home the weekend before Christmas, both she and Ed were incredibly responsive.
Since this is called Amish Paradise, I will mention how interesting it was to learn more about the Amish community, to see them living without electricity, and traveling by horse and cart. The view from the side porch was amazing. We also enjoyed visiting Apple Castle and Cheese House.
This will be our homebase from now on when we visit family.

The beds were very comfortable. The hosts were very friendly and helpful. This was our second visit, and we’d certainly come back.

Group trip
review_text: Ed and Gina's place was perfect for our family get-away this year. The house was very clean and decorated so cute for fall. When we walked in, you immediately felt at home. The view from the porch is breathtaking. We spent a lot of time out there enjoying coffee and watching the sunrise and sunset. It was very peaceful and so relaxing. Ed and Gina communicated well, always getting back to us quickly when we had any questions. The house was in a great location, we were able to visit the local Amish Shops and Volant, The Grove City Outlets, and we drove into Ohio to do some shopping. We recommend Apple Castle, Manginos Pizzeria, Byler's Quilt Shop, and Anna's Baked Goods. We got complimentary donuts from Gina and Ed, which were so delicious and such a great treat. We would definitely stay again if we come back to the area. Thanks Ed and Gina for letting our family make memories in your beautiful house.

Ed and Gina’s home is perfect! The photos accurately show what a charming home this is - beautifully decorated and so homey! Super clean, comfy beds, and a well-stocked kitchen with everything you could need. We loved the large yard with firepit and plenty of seating…and the lovely wrap-around porch for morning coffee and family time. Gorgeous views! Our adult kids hung out there and stayed up to watch the sunset. If you’re lucky enough to stay on a Friday or Saturday, you really must go down the road a bit to the Amish farmhouse called Anna’s Baked Goods. Oh.My.God. You have never tasted anything like their donuts and baked goods!
Ed and Gina are such attentive hosts! Responses were very quick and they came through in the clutch for us when there was a utensil that we needed. We hope to stay again!

We lived on the porch from sunrise to bed time, watching the changing sky and land, and listening for the clip-clip of Amish buggies passing by. Gina and Ed have created a very special place for guests, and are responsive and helpful in every way. Thank you so much for a memorable stay!

We were able to cook meals easily, and had lots of choices for dinner nearby.
We sat on the porch and drank coffee, and hiked at McConnell’s Mill State park.
Would love to return for another weekend away!

It was chilly when we stayed so we didn't get out to the firepit but it is the perfect area to do some stargazing! Maybe next time!! I would not hesitate to recommend staying at Amish Paradise and I hope to do the same when we come back to the area...Thank you Ed and Gina for your wonderful hospitality😊

name: Brian
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2021
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Ed and Gina were AMAZING hosts. We felt we had a million and one questions for them and they never grew impatient with us. We had a family of six (seven with Grandma for a few days) for nearly ten days total. Ed and Gina were two houses down and treated us like family. They emptied our trash utility can when we missed curbside pickup, they bought a new fire pit while we were there and plenty of firewood so we could enjoy nights under the stars, they ensured we always had fresh drinking water on hand, they washed our linens and towels while we were there..truly above and beyond! They were very gregarious and generous and accommodating to our little ones as well. Do your best to respect their home and they will in turn be respectful of you!
About the home.. amazing! Far away from Pittsburgh that you feel out of the city but close enough for a day trip. Cozy bed and bedrooms, family sized couch, high pressure shower, and a welcoming kitchen and table for home cooked meals. Look no further for a home away from home :)

We loved the comfy furniture, decorations and amenities. There were plenty of quality linens and a nice, hot shower with good water pressure. There are some condiments in the fridge and a Keurig with a few coffee & tea options, so as long as you bring your own food, you will have everything you need! Thanks for a great stay, Patti!

review_text: We chose this stay for proximity to Westminster College. Host is very quick to respond and detailed with directions. The space is clean and cozy with helpful notes throughout. We immediately felt comfortable making ourselves at home for the weekend. Everything is as described. You can tell a lot of thought and care has been put into the decor and amenities. No TVs in the bedrooms but the WiFi works fine for ipads/laptops. It’s important to note that the suite is attached to the main house so you can hear house sounds. It wasn’t disruptive, just something we hadn’t thought about when booking. This was a perfect location for us with close proximity to a delicious dinner at Talbots, a Saturday stroll through Volant, and a chilly afternoon football game. If visiting the college, I would strongly prefer this location over the 2.5 star hotels near the outlets. Thank you!!

This was a beautifully clean home. Perfect stop for one night during our road trip.
The only issue was that the home was freezing. It was 45 degrees outside and the bedrooms were ice cold and there was no heat.
My husband and I had to sleep on the floor in the living room near the space heater (faux fireplace). We didn’t realize it was that cold in the bedrooms until late at night and dressed for bed. We never wrote the hosts (but wish we had). The house got colder and colder as the night went on. If you stay here, just make sure the heat is on, if it’s cold outside.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Save Haven is just that- a well appointed, beautifully decorated space tucked away on a quiet street in the safe countryside of New Wilmington. Patti's space is very comfortable, and filled with many extra, caring touches. You can feel her warmth and thoughtfulness throughout the entire space, I immediately felt relaxed upon arrival. The kitchen is well equipped, the shower has great water pressure, the couches and the beds are very comfy- all things making it feel just like home. Patti is a wonderful and gracious hostess- there to answer any question you may have or to chat with if you would like. She went above and beyond for my stay making sure I had pillows that would work well with my bad neck, which was so greatly appreciated. It is kindness like this that show why she is a Superhost and that she truly cares about her guests and their comfort.
The location is very convenient to area colleges/universities and shopping and at the same time gives you a feel for true Amish country, if you've never experienced it before. You cannot go wrong booking at Safe Haven. I highly recommend and would give more than 5 stars if I could! I am looking forward to my next stay to relax and recharge! Thank you again, Patti!

name: Douglas
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
December 2018
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Great place in a quiet town in western PA. We stayed here at Christmas time, and the unit was festooned with holiday decorations and lights that were fun and tasteful.
The basics: everything was very clean - carpets, towels, bed linens, etc. There were enough bath and bed linens to keep us warm and clean. Soap and shampoo are provided. The heating, plumbing, and electricity all worked fine. There is enough parking space for 1 car and parking is free. The hosts mentioned in the listing that the WI-FI is spotty. This is true; it was not working during our stay. This is due to the location. I was able to use my hotspot for internet access.
The unit is a basement apartment in the house - not the whole house. To get into it you have to go down a flight of stairs, so if you have trouble with stairs, this is not the place for you.
It's located in a rural part of Lawrence County, so dining and grocery options are limited. There are a few places is New Wilmington and nearby Volant, but otherwise you need to go to New Castle or Hermitage. Pittsburgh is an hour away. This place really is a retreat! It's very quiet here, which is exactly what we came for.

name: Michael & Carrie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2018
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We were so very pleased with our stay- it far exceeded our expectations for what we needed! Myself, my husband and teen son needed to stay in New Wilmington for our son's wedding at the Irons Mill Farmstead and everything that we needed for the weekend was met by this lovely garden 2 bedroom, roomy one bath apartment and host. Having the ironing board & iron available was a huge help with dressing for the wedding. Plenty of fridge space & kitchen space for our cookies for the Pittsburgh Cookie Table which would have been a huge issue staying in a hotel. We loved the decor, very tasteful, we especially liked the coffee beans used as decor in the kitchen, very cute. The bedrooms were roomy with plenty of closet space and very tastefully decorated in calming colors and lovely accents, the beds were very comfy, the shower hot and full power and the games in the cupboard were fun! We plan to buy a toss- a-cross for the winter blues!! A very large flat screen TV with DVD movies we liked, Plenty of breakfast drink choices, paper products, lovely dishes and everything available to cook up a great meal. What a blessing it was to find this special home, 9 minute easy drive to the venue and great nights of sleep with comfy space for relaxing and dressing made what could have been stress into a smooth sail!! Having control settings for the temperature of the rental area would have been helpful but when I called about it they were right on it and it was cooled down within minutes so it really was not an issue. Plenty of parking space and the home is on the end of the street in complete privacy with a lovely yard & grounds overlooking amish farms and cornfields- sat out in the early morning in my pajamas watching the sun come up with a cup of tasty coffee in hand. Hope to some day be back again as we felt right at home and very welcomed.

name: Micah
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2018
,

Stayed about a week
review_text:
WARM AND WELCOMING.
The family hosting the place is AMAZING. Their communication was above and beyond, the place was VERY clean and the decoration was the warm touch to make you feel like you were actually home. Joey helped me unload my vehicle and gave me the tour of the place.
I worked in the area and it was perfect because it was not too far from many large highways. The amish community was an awesome touch and added the small town experience. The town was welcoming and made friends in the few days I was there!! There are multiple breweries and food restaurants within 15 minutes from the home which were delicious. ( Recommend 32 brewery and the crane room. )
The home was perfect for a long or short term stay because they all the amenities that you would need (even EXTRA ones too; coffee, soap, cooking utensils and supplies). There is a washer and dryer available but it is shared with the family in their house. (they let you do laundry anytime and even shared their detergent when I forgot mine) The only complaint I have is that the airbnb location is in the family's basement (does not feel or even smell like one) BUT you can hear them upstairs talking, watching tv and playing the drums. Although that should be expected while sharing a home with another family I suppose.
Overall, I would highly recommend this home and if in the area, I will definitely be staying again! Joey and Patti are a dream host and make anyone feel welcome in their home.

review_text: Our stay in Patti’s home was comfortable and pleasant. The town and area of New Wilmington are pretty and Patti's home is attractive. Patti was quick to communicate with us and was eager to please. She also graciously allowed us a late check out, which we really appreciated. The only downside was that the wifi did not work well for us, although Patty tried to remedy it. Also, her place was difficult to find even after following instructions to first go to Westminster College and then route ourselves from there. Our GPS took us to a neighbor across large fields, and it was not easy or straightforward, as it would seem, to get around those fields to her home. This was probably in part because it was dark. I wouldn't mention this if other guests hadn't also had trouble finding it. If you're arriving at night, you really don't want to feel lost. So, I suggest you ask Patty for directions and not rely on your GPS.

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text: I read all the reviews, but this was my first Air BNB experience, so I had my reservations. First of all, Patti is amazing. When I was still searching for a place to stay, I wrote her and she responded within the hour. She then invited us to stay. After I booked, Patti promptly wrote and told me to let her know what my expected arrival time would be so that she could meet, give me the key, and give a little tour. I didn't read everything, or else I would have known that my GPS was going to send me to a field, but when I wrote in a sort of panic she immediately sent her number for me to contact her. I managed to find it as New Wilmington isn't huge, but she was so prompt. When we arrived she came running out to see if we were ok. We parked out 24 foot trailer at her place, as she had previously said we could. There was plenty of room and Patti was beyond gracious. The place is immaculate, the town is quaint, and I couldn't have asked for a better time. I will return, if just to see Patti again.
